alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 4:45PM MST until December 20 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches Essex to Marias Pass. 1 to 3 inches snow for low elevations. Flash freeze as temperatures fall, especially near Badrock Canyon. * WHERE...Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Flash freezing of roadways. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
